title: [bug] [CLI] Halo/gray fringe appears around icons generated by `tauri icon` when using transparent PNG/SVG input

labels.name: status: needs triage
labels.description: This issue needs to triage, applied to new issues

body: ### Describe the bug When using `tauri icon` with a transparent-background source (PNG or SVG), the output icons show a faint gray/uneven fringe around curved edges (e.g., circles). Edges show semi-transparent or tinted pixels (light grey) around curved shapes and transparency boundaries. ### Reproduction 1. Create a circular logo image with transparency (e.g., white circle on transparent background) in PNG or export as SVG (example attached). 2. Run `tauri icon`. 3. Examine the generated icons, youâ€™ll see a light gray fringe around the outer edge of the shape. ### Expected behavior Output icons should have clean edges, outer pixels for transparent regions should be fully transparent and have zero RGB bleed ### Full `tauri info` output ```text [âœ”] Environment - OS: Windows 10.0.26200 x86_64 (X64) âœ” WebView2: 141.0.3537.71 âœ” MSVC: Visual Studio Community 2022 âœ” rustc: 1.90.0 (1159e78c4 2025-09-14) âœ” cargo: 1.90.0 (840b83a10 2025-07-30) âœ” rustup: 1.28.2 (e4f3ad6f8 2025-04-28) âœ” Rust toolchain: stable-x86_64-pc-windows-msvc (default) - node: 22.20.0 - pnpm: 10.17.1 - npm: 10.9.3 [-] Packages - tauri ğŸ¦€: 2.8.5 - tauri-build ğŸ¦€: 2.4.1 - wry ğŸ¦€: 0.53.3, (outdated, latest: 0.53.4) - tao ğŸ¦€: 0.34.3, (outdated, latest: 0.34.4) - @tauri-apps/api îœ˜: 2.8.0 - @tauri-apps/cli îœ˜: 2.8.4 [-] Plugins - tauri-plugin-global-shortcut ğŸ¦€: 2.3.0 - @tauri-apps/plugin-global-shortcut îœ˜: 2.3.0 - tauri-plugin-dialog ğŸ¦€: 2.4.0 - @tauri-apps/plugin-dialog îœ˜: 2.4.0 - tauri-plugin-deep-link ğŸ¦€: 2.4.3 - @tauri-apps/plugin-deep-link îœ˜: 2.4.3 - tauri-plugin-updater ğŸ¦€: 2.9.0 - @tauri-apps/plugin-updater îœ˜: 2.9.0 - tauri-plugin-store ğŸ¦€: 2.4.0 - @tauri-apps/plugin-store îœ˜: 2.4.0 - tauri-plugin-process ğŸ¦€: 2.3.0 - @tauri-apps/plugin-process îœ˜: 2.3.0 - tauri-plugin-opener ğŸ¦€: 2.5.0 - @tauri-apps/plugin-opener îœ˜: 2.5.0 - tauri-plugin-single-instance ğŸ¦€: 2.3.4 - @tauri-apps/plugin-single-instance îœ˜: not installed! - tauri-plugin-positioner ğŸ¦€: 2.3.0 - @tauri-apps/plugin-positioner îœ˜: 2.3.0 - tauri-plugin-fs ğŸ¦€: 2.4.2 - @tauri-apps/plugin-fs îœ˜: not installed! [-] App - build-type: bundle - CSP: ... - frontendDist: ../dist - devUrl: http://localhost:1420/ - framework: React - bundler: Vite ``` ### Stack trace ```text ``` ### Additional context It appears the icon generatorâ€™s resizing pipeline (using `image::imageops::resize_exact(...)` with `FilterType::Lanczos3`) operates on non-premultiplied RGBA data, causing RGB â€œleakâ€ from semi-transparent edge pixels during downscaling. A fix could be to premultiply alpha before resizing, then unpremultiply afterward, and optionally set fully transparent pixelsâ€™ RGB to 0 to prevent color bleed while keeping smooth antialiased transparency.
